text: Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond. Clear, dark golden in colour. Slightly fizzy with a small head. Strong pear nose, slightly salty on the mouth at first. Quite honey, a little syrupy.
Bottle from Rehills of Jesmond. Pours golden and sparkling. The aroma is fresh pear with a slight vinegar twang. The taste is sweet pear with some acidity and a dryish finish. Quite nice.

750ml bottle from Drinkswell, Ripon. 2.5%. Yellow golden colour, short-lived fizzy white foam head and aroma of pear, apple, woody, vanilla. Taste is sweet juicy pear, some tartness, fruity, vanilla and hints of honey, caramel. Slightly syrupy mouthfeel, medium bodied, fine carbonation, dry tart finish. Quite drinkable.

Dobry cydr z gruszkowego sfermentowanego soku. Chyba jeden z najlepszych jakie pilem w tym gatunku. Polecam kazdemu. Ciemno zoltawa barwa i wyrazny aromat swiezych gruszek, a w smaku juz jakby stare ulegalki. Gruszkowa soczystosc i slodkosc guruje tu nad wszelkimi innymi smakami. Male nagazowanie i niewielka piana. Ladna butelka z ciekawa etykieta.

Bottle 750ml.Unclear matt medium yellow colour with a small, fizzy, fair lacing, fully diminishing, white head. Aroma is moderate pear - apple, sweet pear, vanilla. Flavour is moderate to heavy sweet with a average to long duration, sweet pear - apple, vanilla, pear, light earthy apple - pear. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20120529]
Bottled. An unclear golden beer with a white head. The aroma has notes of pears. The flavor is sweet with notes of pears and lemons, leading to a dry finish.
75 cL bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Aroma is citric perry fruity and light yeasty. Sweet, citric and crisp perry juicy. Sweet and light citric finish. Almost apple like citric.

Bottle, cloudy pale yellow with a small bubbly white head. Fruity aroma, a little unclean. Fermented pears, a little sulhur, farmhouse yeasty, matchstick. Very refreshing taste, fruity sweet, little tart, crisp.

cloudy yellow, smooth white head.
pear aroma,  flowery, very low bitterness.
flavor is pear, faint citrussy, faint candy, pear flavor is quite authentic.

Bottle 75 cl. Courtesy of fonefan. Pours a cloudy pale yellow with a white head. Rustic, skewed pear aroma - unclean farmhouse style. Light body, sweet pear and apple, again slightly unclean and fusty in a farmhouse style, ends on a slightly tart note. Quite fresh and enjoyable really. 290512

Corked bottle at Crêperie Le Petit Morbihan, rue Odessa, Paris, 2% ABVLight blond color, no head. Light aroma of pears. Weak body, average pear juice flavor, with a good share of acidity; quite balanced and enjoyable, yet simple.

Tan colour. Light fizz.  Fresh pear, slight tannin on the nose.  Soft body as befits a French breakfast perry.  Light fruitiness.  A nice light beverage but you can tell its industrial by its lack of character.

Bottle at Josselins Creperie in Paris. Lovely golden hue and nice looking carbonation. Mild aroma is a sweeter, softer pear like a Bartlett. Not much woodiness. Soft palate. One of the sweeter perries I have had but it is lovely. Not complex, rather simple, but good and refreshing and with 2% alcohol serves a very good function as a refreshing lunch hour bevvie.
